intro: Batratherum cuspidatum, commonly known as the needlepod grass, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into elongated, pointed seed pods. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
